title.narrative: Building Community Resilience in sustainable forest management in Sudan, North Darfur State

description.narrative: Climate change in Darfur has disrupted people’s lives by curtailing the availability of resources, prevalence of recurrent droughts thus resulting in negatively impacting on food security and livelihoods thereby spurring greater competition and con?ict. Human activities due to limited livelihood opportunities, which include cutting down trees by brick moulders, charcoal making for household use and population increase has resulted in deforestation thus contributing to changing rainfall patterns and compounding on the negative impact of climate . The main objectives of the project are to: (1) Improve communities’ resilience by introducing alternative solutions to deforestation and support communities’ awareness to effectively engage in forestry management and (2) introduce and build the capacity of the local implementing partner on the rolling out and application of CAFOD’s Environmental Stewardship Tool (EST). This shall be achieved through a combination of interventions which will include selection of beneficiaries, training of selected beneficiaries to build climate resilience, provision of support in terms of inputs for the selected beneficiaries which will include forest nurseries establishment, pasture management, alternative sources of energy , support for alternative brick moulding processes for the youths.
